intro: Sida begonioides, commonly known as the begonia-like sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant features palmate leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Sida begonioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
